conclusion: The problem involves determining the internal resistance of a silicon photocell based on a given U-I graph.
Line a represents the U-I relationship of a battery under a certain light intensity, and line b represents the U-I relationship of a resistance R.
The open-circuit voltage \\( U_{oc} \\) is identified as 5 V from the graph.
The short-circuit current \\( I_{sc} \\) is identified as approximately 0.4 A from the graph.
The operating point is where the load line b intersects the battery's U-I curve a.
The intersection point is at \\( U = 2.5 \, \text{V} \\) and \\( I = 0.2 \, \text{A} \\).
The internal resistance \\( r \\) is calculated using the formula \\( r = \frac{U_{oc} - U}{I} \\).
Substituting the known values gives \\( r = \frac{5 \, \text{V} - 2.5 \, \text{V}}{0.2 \, \text{A}} = 12.5 \, \Omega \\).
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell is determined to be 12.5 Î©.
